stories.text: I have been writing software professionally for almost 3 years now at a small company. However, code quality and software testing are just not part of the culture in my workplace. I want to advance in my career and feel that I lack so much when it comes to writing tests. I am familiar with the idea and have done a few "calculator testing" examples in python. However, when a projects involve databases and various other components, I don't know where to start. I would like to ask for any resources that help develop software testing skills for experienced programmers.
stories.title: Ask HN: Resources for writing tests for experienced programmers?
